title: SLUMDOG!
licensing_note: Lyrics via Musixmatch API; translations via Google Translate API; grammar notes auto-generated placeholders.

lines.text: Yeah, yeah, teraz by chcieli być jak ja
lines.translation: Yeah, yeah, now they want to be like me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Nie raz nie robisz nic, jak ja
lines.translation: You don't do anything like me sometimes
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Mieć sos i taki fit—
lines.translation: Have sauce and such fit—
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Ej, ej, ej (yo)
lines.translation: Hey, hey, hey (yo)
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Dawaj mi klucze do miasta, bo jak wracam tam, to czuję się jak Slumdog
lines.translation: Give me the keys to the city, because when I go back there I feel like Slumdog Millionaire.
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Nie śmigam na pieszo, lecz z daleka słychać warkot
lines.translation: I'm not on foot, but I can hear the roar from afar
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Za mną kordon na rowerach i ktoś jedzie rafką
lines.translation: Behind me there is a cordon of bikes and someone is riding a raft
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Zatrzymują mnie na światłach i chcą fotkę — mówię: "bardzo proszę"
lines.translation: They stop me at a traffic light and want a photo - I say, "Please."
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Wjeżdżam w tę alejkę, co łączy się z moim blokiem
lines.translation: I enter this alley that connects with my block
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Idzie młody, a ja idę o stówę, że niesie koper (smoke)
lines.translation: Here comes the young one, and I bet he's carrying some smoke
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Tam, gdzie po tej bibie spałem, zbudowali hotel
lines.translation: Where I slept after that party, they built a hotel
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Sprawdzam zmiany na osiedlu jak jebany deweloper (oh)
lines.translation: I'm checking the changes in the estate like a fucking developer (oh)
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: I nas wyganiali z dachu, bo mieli to za głupotę
lines.translation: And they threw us off the roof because they thought it was stupid.
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Ale jak wyganiali mnie wtedy, nie wiedzieli, że jestem kotem
lines.translation: But when they were throwing me out, they didn't know I was a cat.
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Teraz ich dzieci do szkoły mówią: "mamo, proszę do tej"
lines.translation: Now their children go to school saying: "Mom, please go to this one"
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: No bo Jeżyk dał tam płytę, która pokryła się złotem (wow)
lines.translation: Well, because Jeżyk released an album there that went gold (wow)
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Ja, teraz by chcieliby być jak ja
lines.translation: Me, now they would like to be like me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Nie raz nie robić nic, jak ja
lines.translation: More than once do nothing, like me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Mieć sos i taki fit jak ja
lines.translation: Have sauce and be as fit as me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: A wiesz, nie chcieli być jak ja
lines.translation: And you know, they didn't want to be like me.
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Teraz by chcieliby być jak ja
lines.translation: Now they would like to be like me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Nie raz nie robić nic, jak ja
lines.translation: More than once do nothing, like me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Mieć sos i taki fit jak ja
lines.translation: Have sauce and be as fit as me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: A wiesz, nie chcieli—
lines.translation: And you know, they didn't want—
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Właśnie mijam dupę — ona mnie nie chciała, też jej nie chcę teraz
lines.translation: I'm just passing by the ass - she didn't want me, I don't want her now either
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Ale wtedy bym się pociął za nią, zmienił et cetera
lines.translation: But then I would cut myself for her, change her, etc.
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Śmiała się z tych portków i mnie miała za pozera
lines.translation: She laughed at those pants and thought I was a poseur.
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: A na trasie coś pisała, czy na backstage ją zabieram? (Woo)
lines.translation: Did she write anything on the tour, should I take her backstage? (Woo)
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Ty, a ta z pierwszej ławki była spoko niby (taa)
lines.translation: You, and the one in the first row was kind of cool (yeah)
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Po lekcjach paliła hajs, z Maroko niby
lines.translation: After classes she smoked cash, supposedly from Morocco
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Co by nie mówić — zawsze miała jakieś perspektywy
lines.translation: Whatever you say, she always had some prospects
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Najwyższe oceny w klasie i prezerwatywy
lines.translation: Top marks in class and condoms
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Yo, powiedz koleżankom, niech wystawią kolumny na balkon
lines.translation: Yo, tell your friends to put the speakers on the balcony
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Spodoba się to nawet sąsiadkom
lines.translation: Even the neighbors will like it
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: Zwołaj tu każdego, kto tu był — ja będę bandą
lines.translation: Call everyone who was here - I'll be the gang
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.text: A jak coś tu rozjebiemy, to w końcu mam na to banknot
lines.translation: And if we mess something up here, I finally have a banknote for it.
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.

lines.translation: Me, now they would like to be like me
lines.grammar: Polish line; watch Slavic case endings and aspectual verb choice.
